item.description: "I will also do it with three women and you will see an outbreak amongst the women. The women are going to see my visitation for they have been accused of the fall. Now they will be responsible for redemption in the end time. Watch and see what the devil of hell tried to do about this, for they will mock and rise and point the finger and the Anti-Christ spirit will be unveiled. But i will break the pagan spirit over this nation and I will bring about a harvest and it's begun." - God

item.title: The Second Annual One Needle Show aired on 29-Dec-2007
item.description: The show stumbled to a hesitant start with some records and stuff. We fired up the sampler and began wave synthesis, feeding the beefed up waves directly into the oscillator unit. As the sampler's injector coils began to overheat we had to cool them by pouring cold beer over the entire unit. Soon things settled into a blissful steady state and that's when the lights went out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dusty visits. Last show of 2007 goes well

item.title: I miss you already Ashleigh
item.description: :sad:

item.title: 01-Dec-2007 - waiting for the first snow to fall
item.description: It must have been the guy that called in last week telling me that i should play live. i'm actually starting to enjoy listening to the music i create, even the stuff that ends with me getting extremely frustrated and exhausted and never sounds 'right'. But some of this stuff i made a few months ago i've forgotten and hearing it again is interesting. I recognise the sounds but don't recall how i made them. I'm impressed with myself but unable to recreate what i've already created. Have I won, or have I lost?
item.itunes:subtitle: i shamelessly play my own music.

item.title: The worst movie i've ever seen was released on 10-Mar-2007
item.description: well the secret untold story of this episode is that the CiTR studio is in shambles. The studio monitor has been replaced with a ashitty boombox and you can't turn the mic channel off lest a horrible buzz be broadcast. So you are stuck at the desk, listening to the show through headphones, afraid to make a noise because you can't turn off the mic channel... anyway about the show: Starts off with some Career Suicide, starring Farkas and Marnier (aka miller). Then i play the entire secret mommy discography apparently and some cartoon intros and some porn reviews (that's for you Bryce)
item.itunes:subtitle: thank you secret mommy

item.title: 13-Jan-2007 was not a good night for dead air
item.description: technical blunders. I rant about equipement. I do a complete show without saying 'uh'. I play 20 minutes of porn through a sampler.
item.itunes:subtitle: But how do you kill that which has no life?

item.title: You say 'Tomato', I say " 06-Jan-2007 "
item.description: The dome collapsed! The dome collapsed! Joel comes in with a saw and a bow and makes the sound of something dying. The show really gets good in the last half hour (as usual) when we get a nutso caller. Sppoooookky
item.itunes:subtitle: Joel's saw has the audience sawing logs

item.title: The year ended on 30-Dec-2006
item.description: Dusty melts the reel to reel and the new kids rock the house. We get our bullshit called by a caller (thanks Tim!) and more, all done one handed! Seriously though, only having one working turntable really made it hard to do the show. The result is a show full of pockets of dead air and interspersed with pure unadulterated genious.
item.itunes:subtitle: And the award for 'Worst Show of the Year' goes to...

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Dec-2006 in STEREOPHONIXXXXXXX+(tm)
item.description:
this show wasn't that special, especially the first hour. apparently my computer makes mp3s that no one else can read :(
it all worked out tho, and the last 1.5 hours isn't bad.
blog coming soon... http://www.ilikethescribbles.com/blog/
item.itunes:subtitle: Today I completed my Christmas Shopping, and More!

item.title: The world did NOT end on 09-Dec-2006
item.description:
I had a caller!
haha
item.itunes:subtitle: dawkins on ted haggard, not a memorable show

item.title: 02-Dec-2006 was a cold day.
item.description: for $1000 he won't tell your wife.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ted Haggard knows what you did last night

item.title: the day (18-Nov-2006) will live on in infamy
item.description: very little talking, lots of noise. We discover the reel to reel. The North Fraser Correctional Center visits booking line.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dusty makes some noise

item.title: FUNdriving under the influence - 11-Nov-2006
item.description: lots of pitching for tha citr funddrive. yay
item.itunes:subtitle: pitching it hard, call from a panhandler, dopeness

item.title: Broadcast on 04-Nov-2006, with love
item.description:
stuff, more stuff, and some dating tips. Go george! Oh and eskimos.
also matthew dear, a full hour of it. sheeeit
item.itunes:subtitle: tech-no! nooooo!!!!

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Sep-2006
item.description:
The experiment didn't go so well.
I wanted to use the audio software on my pc at home during the show, so I streamed audio from my home pc to the station and tried to control the music software through remote desktop.
It almost worked, but when you've got 30 seconds of latency to deal with, you better know what you're mixing. I didn't :(
item.itunes:subtitle: part 1 of "Today's Experiment: Remote Audio"

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Sep-2006
item.description:
The experiment didn't go so well.
I wanted to use the audio software on my pc at home during the show, so I streamed audio from my home pc to the station and tried to control the music software through remote desktop.
It almost worked, but when you've got 30 seconds of latency to deal with, you better know what you're mixing. I didn't :(
PS: i don't know where part 1 is...
item.itunes:subtitle: part 2 of "Today's experiment: remote audio"
